intro: Enodium sylvaticum, commonly known as the woodland thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the woodlands of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. It produces small, round fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a hard, spiky capsule. Enodium sylvaticum is often found in moist, shaded environments and is considered a rare and protected species in some regions.
